node.name: Web Search
node.shortdescription: The Web Search plugin for Eclipse allows you to search for selected text using a variety of search engines and services, including Google, Google Code Search, Bing, FindJar, and Stack Overflow. The search engines can be accessed from the workbench search menu or the context menu any time text can be extracted from the current selection. Furthermore, the plugin intelligently handles searching for selected Java artifacts. For example, if a compilation unit is selected and is searched on Google Code Search, the Web Search plugin will automatically add language tags to the query and strip off the file extension (.java).
node.body: The Web Search plugin for Eclipse allows you to search for selected text using a variety of search engines and services, including Google, Google Code Search, Bing, FindJar, and Stack Overflow. The search engines can be accessed from the workbench search menu or the context menu any time text can be extracted from the current selection. Furthermore, the plugin intelligently handles searching for selected Java artifacts. For example, if a compilation unit is selected and is searched on Google Code Search, the Web Search plugin will automatically add language tags to the query and strip off the file extension (.java).
